content.description: Tesla is set to roll out its long-promised robotaxi service, marking a major milestone after years of autonomous vehicle hype from Elon Musk.
CarMax stock climbed sharply as used-vehicle sales hit their strongest growth in nearly four years.
Reports indicate that Meta recently pursued an acquisition of Safe Superintelligence, the $32 billion AI firm co-founded by OpenAI’s ex–chief scientist Ilya Sutskever.
Aflac confirmed a cyberattack on Friday that potentially compromised personal data for an unknown number of its policyholders.
Following its participation in the $500 billion Stargate AI infrastructure initiative, SoftBank is reportedly preparing its most ambitious AI endeavor yet in robotics.
Trump now has a self-imposed two-week deadline to decide on U.S. involvement in the Middle East conflict, injecting short-term uncertainty while allowing potential diplomatic shifts with Iran.

outlook: U.S. markets may be entering a delicate phase. The S&P 500 is flirting with record highs (≈5,950–6,000), fueled by robust institutional and retail demand—particularly from retirement accounts—with strong earnings from cyclical names like CarMax, and sustained interest in mega‑cap tech and AI plays.
